lines.content: **StackOverflown** is a feature-rich personal task management application designed for users who prefer a blend of **Command Line Interface (CLI) efficiency** and **Graphical User Interface (GUI) convenience**. Organize your tasks, set deadlines, plan events, and boost your productivity with our intuitive chat-style interface!
1. **Prerequisites**: Ensure you have **Java 11** or later installed on your computer.
2. **Download**: Get the latest `stackoverflown.jar` file from the [releases page](https://github.com/kbyeo/ip/releases).
3. **Launch**: Double-click the JAR file or run the following command:
4. **Start Managing**: The GUI will appear with a welcome message. Type your first command in the text field and press **Enter** or click **">"**!
5. **First Steps**: Try these commands to get started:
> You can use both the GUI chat interface and CLI mode interchangeably. The GUI provides visual feedback while the CLI offers quick keyboard-driven interaction.
StackOverflown supports three types of tasks to cover all your productivity needs:
Create simple tasks without specific deadlines.
Boom! A ToDo task just joined the party:
Your task arsenal now stands at 1 strong!.
Create tasks with specific due dates for time-sensitive work.
All set! A Deadline task just joined the party:
Your task arsenal now stands at 2 strong!
All set! A Deadline task just joined the party:
Your task arsenal now stands at 3 strong!
> Time is optional for deadline tasks. If not specified, it defaults to end of day (11:59pm).
Create tasks with start and end times for meetings and appointments.
Tada! An Event task just joined the party:
Your task arsenal now stands at 4 strong!
Mark completed tasks with a checkmark for visual progress tracking.
Boom! That task is history - marked as done and dusted:
Remove the done status from tasks if you need to work on them again.
Aha! This task is no longer done - it's waiting for your magic touch again:
Permanently remove tasks you no longer need.
Your task arsenal now stands at 3 strong!
> Deleted tasks cannot be recovered. Make sure you really want to remove the task before confirming.
Display your complete task list with status indicators and indices.
Search for tasks containing specific keywords (case-insensitive).
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Organise your task list by various criteria for better productivity management.
| **Creation Order** | `sort creation` | Original task entry sequence |
| **Task Type** | `sort type` | Groups Todo → Deadline → Event |
| **Completion Status** | `sort status` | Pending tasks first, completed last |
| **Deadline Date** | `sort deadline` | Chronological order by due dates |
| **Alphabetical** | `sort alpha` | A-Z order by task description |
> Use `sort deadline` before important due dates to prioritise time-sensitive tasks!
Close the application and save all your data automatically.
> All your tasks are automatically saved when you exit. No manual saving required!
| **Add Event** | `event DESCRIPTION /from DATE TIME /to DATE TIME` | `event meeting /from 2025-12-10 1400 /to 2025-12-10 1600` |
A: Tasks are automatically saved to a local data file in the same directory as the application. Your data persists between sessions.
**Q: Can I use the application offline?**
A: Yes! StackOverflown works completely offline. No internet connection required.
**Q: What happens if I enter an invalid date?**
A: The application will show an error message with the correct date format. Please use `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
A: Currently, you need to delete and recreate tasks to modify them. Task editing is planned for future versions.
**Q: How do I backup my tasks?**
A: Your tasks are stored in a local file. Copy the data file to backup your tasks to another location.
**Q: Why can't I see my profile pictures?**
A: Place your avatar images in the `src/main/resources/images/` directory as `ipUserAvatar.png` and `ipBotAvatar.jpg`.
- **Architecture**: Clean MVC design with Parser, TaskList, Storage, and UI components

* Main class for StackOverflown chatbot application.

*

StackOverflown is a personal task management chatbot that helps users organize
* their ToDo tasks, Deadlines, and Events. The application provides a command-line
* interface for adding, managing, and tracking tasks with persistent storage.

*
  • Adding different types of tasks (ToDo, Deadline, Event)

* Main entry point for the application.
* Exception thrown when user attempts to create a task with empty description.

*

This exception is thrown when the Parser detects that a user is trying
* to create a task (todo, deadline, or event) without providing a meaningful
* description. All tasks require non-empty descriptions to be useful for

*

This exception is triggered in the following scenarios:

*
  • Creating deadline with only "/by" date but no task description

*
  • Creating events with only time information but no event description

*
  • Providing only whitespace characters as task description
* todo read book                          // Has meaningful description
* deadline submit project /by 2023-12-01  // Complete with description
* event team meeting /from 1400 /to 1600  // Complete event details
//The javaDocs here was generated using Claude 4.0, as part of the A-AiAssisted increment.
super("Hold up! Your " + taskType + " task needs some substance - what exactly should I track?");
* Exception thrown when user provides an unrecognized or invalid command.

*

This exception is thrown by the Parser when it encounters user input
* that doesn't match any of the supported command formats. It provides
* helpful feedback to guide users toward valid command usage.

*

Supported commands include: todo, deadline, event, list, mark, unmark,

*
  • Entering gibberish or typos in command names
//The javaDocs here was generated using Claude 4.0, as part of the A-AiAssisted increment.
super("Hmm, '" + command + "' isn't in my vocabulary yet - try 'todo', 'deadline', 'event', 'list', " +
* Exception thrown when user input has correct command but incorrect format.

*

This exception is thrown when the Parser recognizes a valid command type
* but the command arguments don't follow the expected format or structure.
* It provides specific guidance on the correct format to use.

*
  • Incorrect date format in deadline or event commands
* event meeting tomorrow 2pm to 4pm      // Missing /from /to format
* deadline project /by invalid-date      // Invalid date format
//The javaDocs here was generated using Claude 4.0, as part of the A-AiAssisted increment.
super("Oops! Format mixup detected. Try this instead: " + correctFormat);
* Exception thrown when user provides an invalid sort type.

*

This exception is thrown when the user attempts to sort tasks using
* an unrecognized or invalid sorting criteria, helping guide users toward
* Constructs an InvalidSortTypeException with specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message explaining the invalid sort type
* Exception thrown when user references a task number that doesn't exist.

*

This exception is thrown when users attempt to perform operations on
* tasks using invalid task numbers. Task numbers are 1-based indices that
* correspond to the task list positions shown to the user.

*
  • Trying to mark/unmark a task with number greater than list size

*
  • Referencing tasks after some have been deleted

*
  • Using non-numeric values where task numbers are expected
//The javaDocs here was generated using Claude 4.0, as part of the A-AiAssisted increment.
super("Uh-oh! That task number doesn't exist in my universe - try again?");
* Base exception class for all StackOverflown application-specific exceptions.

*

This class serves as the parent exception for all custom exceptions thrown
* by the StackOverflown task management application. It extends the standard
* Java Exception class to provide application-specific error handling.

*

All StackOverflown exceptions inherit from this class, allowing for
* centralized exception handling and consistent error messaging throughout

* Handles persistent storage of tasks to and from the file system.

*

The Storage class manages serialization and deserialization of task data
* using a custom pipe-delimited text format. It automatically creates necessary
* directories and provides robust error handling for file operations.

*

Files are stored in "../data/stackoverflown.txt" relative to the application
* working directory, with automatic directory creation if needed.
private static final DateTimeFormatter STORAGE_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-M-d HHmm");
* Loads all tasks from the storage file.

*

Creates the data directory and file if they don't exist. Parses each
* line of the file and reconstructs the appropriate Task objects. Empty lines
* are skipped, and corrupted data triggers appropriate exceptions.

*

For first-time users where no storage file exists, returns an empty
* task list without throwing an exception.
* @return ArrayList of loaded Task objects, empty if no storage file exists
* @throws StackOverflownException if file reading fails or data corruption is detected
return tasks; // Return empty list for first-time users
throw new StackOverflownException("Oops! Had trouble reading your saved tasks: " + e.getMessage());
* Saves all tasks to the storage file.

*

Overwrites the existing file with current task data. Each task is
* serialized to a pipe-delimited format appropriate for its type. Creates
* the data directory if it doesn't exist.
* @param tasks the ArrayList of Task objects to save
* @throws StackOverflownException if file writing fails or directory creation fails

throw new StackOverflownException("Oops! Had trouble saving your tasks: " + e.getMessage());

Event tasks extend the basic Task functionality by adding start and end

* provide formatted output for user display and storage persistence.

* Abstract base class for all task types in the StackOverflown application.

*

This class provides common functionality for task management including
* task completion status, description storage, and basic task operations.
* All concrete task types (ToDo, Deadline, Event) extend this base class.

*
  • A description of what needs to be done

The task is initially marked as not done (false).

* Automatically saves the task list if storage is configured.

* Represents a simple ToDo task without any date or time constraints.

*

ToDo tasks are the simplest form of task in the StackOverflown application,
* containing only a description and completion status. They are ideal for
* general tasks that don't have specific deadlines or time requirements.
